question: Advertisements of snacks and toys have a great impact on children and their parents. So advertisements to the children should be banned. Do you agree or disagree?
shortText: Nowadays, advertisement has become one of the important tools in the marketing of a product. Companies influence their consumers specifically, children and their parents, to buy unhealthy food and gaming items through several commercials. A school of people suggests that these types of ads should be restricted on television and I completely second this opinion because of the reasons, discussed in the following paragraph.

question: Science and technology have improved the standards of living in all over the world. Some people claim that the role of the arts has become insignificant. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
shortText: In recent years, the living conditions have become superior, much of this can be attributed to the growth in sci-tech. There is a view that the significance of art is very less in the improved lifestyles of people across the globe. In my opinion science and technology has aided to a better level of comfort, while, arts and humanities still play an essential role in our lives.

question: Some people think it is more important to spend money on roads and motorways than on public transport systems. To what extend do you agree?
shortText: Investing in roads and motorways instead of public transport systems is a common idea for numerous citizens. I completely disagree with this opinion due to the advantages of spending budget on public transportation and the reasons are outlined below.

question: Government should make laws about people’s nutrition and food choice. Other argue that is their choice. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
shortText: The issue of whether the government should control a human’s meal by-laws has been raising a lot of debates. Some might say that every individual has a right to choose what they want to eat and know what is better for themself and this substantially helps the crowd feel pleased and protected physically . On the contrary, others insist on the opinion that to help inhabitants to grow well, they have to obey the rules in order to be supplied with all nutrients necessary. Viewing from a general perspective, the essay discusses both viewpoints, I personally agree with the former for the following reasons.

question: EXPERTS BELIEVE THAT, OVER THE NEXT DECADE, ROBOT WILL BE DOING MANY OF THE JOBS CURRENTLY DONE BY HUMANS. DISCUSS THE ADVANTAGES AND DISADVANTAGES OF THIS.
shortText: Technology has revolutionalised the world in the last few years. In the near future, pundits reckon that machine will be taking over the work at present performed by humankind. I propound that using automation has numerous merits such as cost-saving and reduced accidents and the demerits like unemployment and increase dependency. This essay will discuss the reasons why I am holding this view.

question: IN MANY COUNTRIES, SMALL SHOPS ARE CLOSING. WHY IS THIS HAPPENING? IS IT A POSITIVE OR NEGATIVE DEVELOPMENT.
shortText: The business represents an organised effort of an individual or strata of the population engaged in making a living. Due to the advancement of technology, the majority of micro sellers subsequently forced to shut down their enterprise. There are multifarious reasons why small enterprises winding up such as competitive price and constraint in stocking the variety of products. I propound that it is an advantageous process for the development of a country.

question:
Some people think it would be a good idea for schools to teach every young person how to be a good parent.

Do you agree or disagree with this opinion? Describe the skills a person needs to be a good parent.

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
shortText: In this contemporary world, it is irrefutable that parents are the best teachers. Some folks support the idea of teaching how to be a good parent in schools. I disagree with the aforementioned notion. The upcoming paragraphs will shed light on this and will explain the skills needed to be a nice parent as well.

question:
Some people think students should study the science of food and how to prepare it. Others think that school time should be used in learning important subjects. Discuss both views and give your opinion?
Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
shortText: While some people are of the opinion that students need to study the nature of food by science and how to cook them, others take the view that schools are the places where they should learn academic subjects. I believe the university will encourage them to learn more about basic nutritional knowledge and ways to prepare healthy meals.

question: Some people think that physical strength is important for success in sport, while other people think that mental strength is more important. Discuss both views and give your opinion
shortText: Recently, the debate on whether physical or mental strength is more important for success in the sport has been heated. As far as I am concerned, the importance of  strength depends on the type of sport. In this essay, I will outline both sides and elaborate on my view.

question:
Some people believe that children's Leisure activities must be educational, otherwise they are a complete waste of time.

Do you agree or disagree?
shortText: Some think that the free time of children must be filled with educational activities, otherwise their time is wasted. I totally disagree with that statement as kids cannot constantly study and they need to release their energy in non-educational activities.

question: Now days many mothers take care of the family and don't go out to work . Some people believe that they should be given salaries by the government . Do you agree or disagree?
shortText: Motherhood is one of the toughest responsibility in society today. Many of them have no decent jobs and just stayed at home to take care of their children and family. I am of the view that the government should give them payment for being a hard-working mother.

question: Some people think that all university students should study whatever they like. Others believe that they should only be allowed to study subjects that will be useful in the future, such as those related to science and technology. Discuss both views these views and give own opinion
shortText: It is common for undergraduates to pursue their passion and chose their prefered major. However, a part of society disagrees with this opinion, stating that only learning subjects related to science and technology should be allowed since it could be more practical in the future. The essay will clarify my opinion that university scholars should be able to enrol in whatever they want to study, as well as discuss aspects of the opposite statement.

question:
Nowadays we are producing more and more rubbish.


Why do you think this is happening?


What can governments do to help reduce the amount of rubbish produced?
shortText: Nowadays, the amount of waste has multiplied widely. This situation happens due to the lack of basic education in society, being, thereby, the responsibility of the government to act in favour of settling this setback. In this essay, I will outline why this phenomenon is taking place and what the government can do to reduce it.

question: The best way to solve world’s environmental problem is to increase the cost of fuel. Do you agree or disagree?
shortText: Some opinions that rising the gasoline and diesel is the most perfect method to deal with the global environmental issues. Personally, I completely disagree with this thought.

question: It is expected that there will be a higher proportion of older people than that of young people in many countries in the future. Do you think it is a positive or negative development?
shortText: Several countries are expected to have an aged population in the future years. As far as I concern, this movement has many negative consequences, thus governments should try to slow down the disproportionate growth of the population.

question: Government should make laws about people’s nutrition and food choice. Other argue that is their choice. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
shortText: The issue of whether the government should control a human’s meal by-laws has been raising a lot of debates. Some might say that every individual has a right to choose what they want to eat and know what is better for themself and this substantially helps the crowd feel pleased and protected physically. On the contrary, others insist on the opinion that to help inhabitants to grow well, they have to obey the rules in order to be supplied with all nutrients necessary. Viewing from a general perspective, the essay discusses both viewpoints, I personally agree with the former for the following reasons.

question: Many countries thought that children have to do homework in their free time while other say children should do more outdoor activity. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
shortText: Children are the backbone and the future of every country; therefore, their better education and character building are considered as the state's responsibility in developed and educated countries. To accomplish this various policies are generated for their education by the government. One of them is to decide whether they should study or do some recreational work during their leisure hours. I strongly agree that children should be allowed to do some outdoor activities after school time

question: In some countries young people are encouraged to work or travel for a year between finishing high school and starting university studies. Discuss the advantages and disadvantages for young people who decided to do this.
shortText: There is a growing trend towards taking a gap year before entering tertiary education among school leavers in certain parts of the world. While it is true that such practice is not without its disadvantages, I would argue that the benefits of going to work or travelling before one embarks on college far outweighs these disadvantages.

question:
Many scientists are concerned about global warming. Research shows that the worldwide increase in temperature is getting worse. Furthermore, global warming seems to be related to levels of pollution in the atmosphere.

Discuss the causes of global warming and possible solutions to the problem.
shortText: The world has witnessed  global challenging ,as high temperature attributed to air pollution for the last few decades. This paramount issue is an alarming problem even for scientists. There are many reasons that can be illustrated for existing the world problem as well as many solutions that can be shown for tackling and avoiding  this matter.

question: Due to the rapid development and expansion of supermarkets in some countries many small, local businesses are unable to compete. Some people think that the closure of local businesses will bring about the death of local communities. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
shortText: In a competitive world where competition is so tough, Many people think that due to the creation of mega shops and multinational brands, local enterprises can not survive. In my opinion, I believe that national companies can still operate although the presence of that aggressive rivalry. That's because governments are still supporting their local corporations and they can take measures to defend their presence. Moreover, these local businesses are much aware of the market dynamics and small communities rather than the big supermarkets.

question: Some people think that strict punishments for driving offenses are the key to reducing traffic accidents. Others, however, believe that other measures would be more effective in improving road safety. Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.
shortText: Nowadays, the vehicle ratio increase dramatically than ever before at the same time way casualty is increasing. A fair amount of society thinks that a severe penalty can decrease  shipment disaster while others say that take other actions would be more successful in order to develop  line safety. I believe strict laws should be there to punish the driving offenders whereas a combination of other methods would bring better results.

question:
Advertising campaigns on TV that are targeted at children should be banned.
To what extent to you agree or disagree with this opinion?
Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
shortText: We live in a world which is full of advertisement and these promotions are  consciously and subconsciously shaping our purchasing power. Nowadays, many ads are targeting only  children on TV, billboards or the internet.  I strongly agree with this statement. This should be prohibited as their strategies to target child is totally unethical and have detrimental effects on our young generation.

question: The growth of online shopping will one day lead to all shops in the towns and cities closing. Do you agree or disagree?
shortText: There is currently a contentious argument over whether online shopping will mean the end of physical stores. I totally disagree with this opinion because local shops are still visited by numerous families and there are some products that are not recommended buying online.

question: Students are becoming more and more reliant on the Internet. While the Internet is convenient, it has many negative effects and its use for educational purposes should be restricted. To what extent do you agree with this statement?
shortText: The accommodation of the Internet has been a driving force to the learners' over-reliance on virtual sources. In my view, I totally agree with the view that we should restrict the use of the Internet for education because this trend has many negative consequences that might undermine the quality of study in schools.

question: Logging rainforest has serious problems on animals  and humans. To what extent do you agree or disagree
shortText: Does deforestation have a perilous impact on living creatures such as wildlife and mankind? This is the most controversial question since in the industrialized and civilized modern world in order to expand the area of living ,forests are being cleared off. A number of people believe this will have a devastating effect. I completely agree with this notion and the same shall be discussed further in this essay.

question: Some people believe that the only purpose of films is to entertain. Others say films should have educational value. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
shortText: It is believed that films should only be evaluated based on their recreational properties, while some  opinions claim that they should as well be able to educate their audiences. In my view, films possess a combination of both qualities, and this essay will explain the point further.

question:
More and more people want to buy clothes, cars and other items with famous brands. 
What are the reasons? 
 Is it a positive or negative development?
shortText: Utility goods such as apparels and vehicles of well-known brands are increasingly favoured by consumers. It is mostly down to the desire for higher product quality and the reliability of the brand names, and in my view, this is a positive trend for several reasons.

question: Now a days we can watch entertainment performances from screen and no need to watch it live.Do you agree or disagree
shortText: Technology has made our lives hassle-free and comfortable .A number of people are of the opinion that ,live shows can be viewed comfortably  from anywhere around due to performances being broadcasted on televisions and the internet.I completely agree with this view and the same shall be discussed further in this essay.

question: 1.	Some people believe that to be successful at a sport you need a natural ability and others think that hard work and practice can make you successful. Discuss both views and give your opinion?
shortText: Most people in society believe that talent plays an important role to be successful whereas others think being persistent and practice are the keys to achieve goals. In my opinion, working hard and keep practising over and over again will give anyone a better chance to achieve goals rather than to depend on the talent itself.

question:
some people get into debt by buying things they don't need and can't afford. what are the reasons for this behaviour?
what actions can be taken to prevent people from having this problem?
shortText: Life has changed over the years. The biggest problem is not worrying about being able to eat something anymore, but the biggest desire of people nowadays is to buy expensive gadgets even if they cannot afford them. This unwise action might lead to debt. Some of the reasons are connecting to the idea of showing the status in the society. By introducing stricter rules, related to the loans, might be a solution.

question: Many people these days choose to work abroad after graduation. Do the advantages of this trend outweigh the disadvantages.
shortText: It is going without saying that being employed abroad following finishing post-secondary schools is skyrocketing that brings pitfalls as well as benefits. Notwithstanding, this discourse delves into both outlooks, and subsequently will put forward my own perspective, accordingly.

question: Many governments invest a great deal of money in space research. What are the advantages and potential disadvantages of spending money on space exploration?
shortText: Understanding the universe beyond the earth's atmosphere is an interesting activity for all the countries across the globe. The majority of governments around the world are spending a huge amount of money to explore space. There are considerable merits and demerits to this phenomenon, however, I will explain why the advantages outweigh the drawbacks in the forthcoming paragraphs.

question:
Nowadays animal experiments are widely used to develop new medicines and to test the safety of other products. Some people argue that these experiments should be banned because it is morally wrong to cause animals to suffer, while others are in favor of them because of their benefits to humanity. 
Discuss both views and give your opinion.
shortText: Conducting experiments on living creatures is commonplace. Although there are some real benefits to the human society favouring the practice, the sufferings of other creatures are much more significant. In my opinion, it is imperative that all forms of animal testing should be completely prohibited by the law.

question: Some people believe that advertisement persue them to buy thing, others think that they do not mind it.Both view and your opinion.
shortText: Nowadays, advertisement is omnipresent. There are some people who think that these commercials make viewers  buy things, the opponents consider this is no longer happens. I,  totally agree with the former’s view because the advert has a strong influence on buying culture.

question: Countries with long average working hours are economically more successful than those countries which do not work long hours. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
shortText: There has been much discussion revolving around whether a higher number of working hours are the key to the nation’s financial success. I personally disagree with that insight, and the reasons will be discussed in this essay.

question: Theoretical subjects such as mathematics and philosophy are taught in universities but students prefer more practical subjects such as accounting and computer programming. Some people believe theoretical subjects should be abandoned in universities. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
shortText: It is true that university students consider career-related subjects more preferable and some people argue that notional curriculums should be dismissed. However, I disagree with this argument and  believe they are essential for higher education.

question: It is a common aspiration between many young people to run their own business rather than work for an employer. Do you think the advantages of working for yourself outweigh the drawbacks?
shortText: Being an entrepreneur is an ability to run a business with successful strategy implementations and bringing profits to the organisation. It has become a dream for many individuals to run a business themselves instead of employing a company. There are considerable merits and some demerits of this decision, which will be discussed in this essay coming forth paragraphs. I will provide supporting reasons and examples to back up why advantages are higher than disadvantages.

question: The care of old people is a growing problem. Some say the government should care for old people. Others say that it is the family’s responsibility. Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.
shortText: An increasing problematic issue looks after aged people.It is argued that caring for old people is whether the response of their relatives or the government .I believe that this topic has to handle both by their family and the government.

question: Some people believe that children should be allowed to choose what subjects they study at school. Others argue that everyone should study the same subjects. Discuss both sides and give your opinion.
shortText: The argument about what subjects school children can study has both sides. Some opiate that there should be a choice while others argue that there should not be. In my opinion, the choice of what courses to major in can be chosen at a certain level.

question: Many museums and historical sites are mainly visited by tourists and not local people. Why is the case? What can be done to attract local people?
shortText: It is often seen that cultural heritage hotspots are mostly popular among outer visitors, not locals. Although this problem can be attributed to a whole host of reasons, some feasible solutions can be considered to address this.

question: Nowadays longer distances are travelled by people to work and study on a daily basis. Some considered it to be a negative development.  While others disagree. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
shortText: At present, people have to travel to work or study on longer distances every day. Some think it is a negative tendency, while others are against this opinion. I believe that such a tendency has more negative effects than positive ones.

question:
Many people put their personal information online (address, telephone number, and so on) for purposes such as signing up for social networks or online banking.
Is this a positive or negative development?
shortText: In the contemporary era of communication, personal details of individuals need to be provided for creating social media and other internet sites accounts. This essay will argue why sharing private information  online has more negative sides than the benefit it has.

question:
some people argue that it is the best to accept bab situation, such as unsatisfied factory job or shortage of money. other believe that it is better to try and improve such situations
discuss both views and give your opinion.
shortText: Handling work pressure has become incredibly difficult nowadays. However, it is argued that contentment with the present condition is better than making some efforts to change and uplift the finances. I completely disagree with the aforesaid notion because working hard in order to live better life can make major transformations in the economic condition of the individual. This essay will discuss both  views.

question: The growing number of overweight people is putting a strain on the health care system in an effort to deal with health issues involved. Some people think that the best way to deal with this problem is to introduce more physical lessons in the school curriculum. To what extent do you agree or disagree.
shortText: Obesity is a concern  throughout the globe and a burden on the health care system. Few individuals are of the opinion that in order to tackle this issue ,more importance should be given to physical training in educational institutions. I completely agree with this opinion  and the same shall be discussed further in this essay

question: Some people think that formal education should start for children as early as possibl. While others think that  it should not start until 7 years of age. Discuss both views and give your opinio.
shortText: In this contemporary world, it is irrefutable that schooling acts as a torchbearer for the youngsters. However, it is argued by many individuals that schooling of  young children must be initiated from the very beginning, while others opine that it should not begin before 7 years of life. In this essay, I will discuss both perspectives and argue why I think the former point is better.

question: With growing populations in cities, more and more people live in homes with little or no outdoor space. Do you think this is a positive or negative development?
shortText: Due to the ever-increasing population, many people today, not by choice, reside in apartments with no place for recreational activities. In my opinion, it is vital to have sufficient space for families.

question: Some people think parents should read or tell stories to children. Others think parents needn’t do that as children can read books or watch TV, movies by themselves. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
shortText: Some people argued that there is no need for parents to read stories since children can help themselves with reading and watching videos. While I understand that there are difficulties for busy fathers and mothers, I believe storytelling is a great measure to help offspring's development.

question: In many countries the widespread use of the internet has given people more freedom to work or study at home instead of travelling to work or college. Do the advantages outweigh the disadvantages?
shortText: Is technology a boon or a bane? This is the most arguable issue as with advancement in  technology people are able to do their  job remotely or do homeschooling rather than commuting to the concerned places. However,  I am of the opinion that the environment which we adapt to while working at an office or studying in educational institutions are more beneficial for the overall growth of the company and also for the personality development of a student.

question:
It is now possible for scientists and tourists to travel to remote natural environments, such as the South Pole.
Do the advantages of this development outweigh the disadvantages?
shortText: Due to the improvement of communication technologies and continuous development of infrastructures, travellers, as well as scientists, are now able to roam around different inaccessible sites, formerly unexplored. Although conquering new areas may hamper the biodiversity of the surroundings and cause injuries or even the demise of any visitors, exploring new areas have many positive aspects such as discovering previously unknown sites and inventing a wide range of natural resources.  In my opinion,  sightseers and researchers should be encouraged to travel around new spots in order to bring benefits to  human civilization.

question:
Some people are born to be leaders, while others believe leadership can be learnt. Discuss
 both views and give opinion
shortText: Leadership is an eye-catching term in our modern life. Some scholars insist that Leaders have their innate set of personality traits that came naturally, and made them distinguished humans. While others believe that leaders can be made through setting the right nurturing environment so they can keep improving their skills. In this essay, I will highlight the two opposing points of view , then I will share my thoughts on why leading people is an art that needs both factors to reach the fullest.

question:
Many young people are leaving their home in rural area to study or work in cities.What 
are the reasons? Do the advantages of this development outweigh  its disadvantages?
shortText: In the contemporary world, the migrant of youth from the countryside to cities is rising. It is opined by many individuals that it is a positive development while others argue that it has a plethora of downsides. In this essay, I will explain about what are the causes of this shift and why I feel it is a beneficial trend.

question: More and more people are eating healthy food and exercise regularly. What are the reasons for that? What can we do to make other people do the same?
shortText: The number of people adhering to healthy food and regular physical activities is rising. The main reasons for that are advances in science and awareness about the benefits of an active lifestyle. Among possible approaches aiming to make other people do the same is school programs telling about the importance of sport and good food.

question: In some countries, people prefer to rent a house than buy one. What are the advantages and disadvantages of renting a property?
shortText: The shelter is one of the basic necessities for every individual whether rented or owned domicile.In various nations, renting a house, condo or apartment has become the first preference over buying one.This has its own merits and demerits which will be explained in the upcoming paragraphs.

question:
Today, the sales of popular consumer goods reflect the power of advertising and not the real needs of the society in which they are sold. 
To what extent do you agree or disagree?
shortText: In this new millennium, profitable sales of desired customer products solely depend on the branding of the product which does not consider the direct requirements of the society. Likewise, I agree with this notion, as buyers are greatly influenced by exaggerated commercials on social media, and they don't invest their money wisely in the inevitable needs.

question: Some people are of the opinion that children should be rewarded for good behaviour. Others think they should be punished for bad behaviour. Discuss both views and give your personal opinion and reasons.
shortText: The minds of the children can be shaped during the early years of their life so caregivers have to be cautious about their behaviour. A few people ponder that offspring should be presented with a reward for showing the best behaviour while others postulate that they should be punished when they misbehave.This essay will discuss both sides of the argument in detail and provide evidence as to why I am personally in favour of motivating a child when they behave in a good manner with everyone.

question: school teachers used to be the source of information . However, some people argue that teachers are not as important as before as the increasing variety of information resources. Do you agree or disagree.
shortText: Although it is believed by certain people that the role of teachers has been superseded by the growing number of informative resources.In my opinion,I completely disagree with this perspective as an evolution of any kind of technology can never replace the intelligence and skills of an instructor.

question: Teenagers should never be put in the same prison with adults no matter how serious their crime is. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this?
shortText: Nowadays, youngsters are getting involved with various crimes in society which warrants a jail term. It has been suggested that they should not be kept with the grown-ups for specific reasons, and I agree entirely with the opinion. This essay will discuss why these two groups should be separated in jail.

question:
Increasing the price of petrol is the best way to solve traffic and pollution problem. 

To what extent do you agree or disagree? 

What other measures do you think might be effective.
shortText: While there are apparent enormous benefits of increasing the fuel rates to curb the problem of pollution and traffic congestion but there are significant discernible drawbacks such as preventing a section of society from accessing personal vehicles. I agree with the former statement to an extent. However, there are alternatives that are beneficial for society at large. Explicated below are the reasons for my assertions.

question: Some people believe that non academic subjects should be removed from the syllabus so that children can concentrate only on academics. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
shortText: Subjects in the classroom course work are chosen meticulously so that they enlighten the students' learning process. However, non-educational domains receive a conflict welcome as the school of thought consider that it breaks the child's attention, whilst others deny it. I strongly contempt the former conviction and elucidate my point of view with suitable reasoning.

question:
It is sometimes said that people should be encouraged to get married before they are 30, as this is the best both for individual and society.
 Do you agree or disagree?
shortText: Some say that creating a family before 30 should be encouraged because it is beneficial for society and individuals. I totally disagree with that because some people are in their prime from the career perspective, while others do not have enough resources for having a comfortable life.

question: Some people think job satisfaction is more important than job security, while others believe that having a permanent job is better than enjoying the job. Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
shortText: It is often argued whether people should opt for satisfying or secured career paths. I believe both sides are important to enjoy life and sustaining a suitable balance of ourselves is essential.

question:
Government investment in the arts, such as music and theatre, is
a waste of money. Governments must invest this money in public
services instead. Do you agree or disagree?
shortText: Some people believe that ministry should advance more money in entertainment and others believe they should be devoted to community facilities. The public should be provided with basic needs by the official such as school, collages, and hospitals while lack of these can harm their survival. It is agreed that investment should be made to benefit people’s need. In my opinion, the absence of learning institution and health administration can increase literacy and death rate in society which can lead to economic problems in a country.

question: Many people are working longer hours. Why is this happening? What problems can this cause to people?
shortText: Today, workers are tending to accept  overtime working at the workplace. This essay will clarify the reasons for this trend and the problems associated.

question:
Children are facing more pressures nowadays from academic, socio,
and Commercial, perspectives. What are the causes of these pressures
and what measures should be taken to reduce these pressures?
shortText: Students experiencing burdens from their education, surrounding community, and commercial perspectives. This essay will explicate the main causes such as competitions in the schools and parents behaviours toward their children along with some appropriate solutions.

question: The movements of people from the villages to the cities for work has caused a lot of problems in both places. What are the serious problems associated with this? What measures can be taken to solve these problems?
shortText: The Industrialization of megapolis has led to an increase in the percentage of persons migrating from rural to urban areas in search of greener pastures. It has therefore led to serious problems such as overpopulation, but there are a number of solutions available to tackle it. This essay will discuss the causes of rural-urban migration and profer solutions to it.

question:
Big salary is much more important than job satisfaction.
Do you agree or disagree?
Provide relevant examples if necessary.
shortText: It is argued that earning lots of money is more significant to people than being happy at a job. This testament disagrees with this statement. I believe that people are increasingly concerned about the risk of stress-related ill-health frequently experienced by them at highly paid jobs and they care more about the feeling of fulfilment at work.

question:
Some people believe that hobbies need to be difficult to be enjoyable.
To what extent do you agree or disagree?
shortText: Some think that if a hobby is not difficult, it will not be enjoyable. I totally disagree with that as it makes a hobby less attractive and there are other more important features.

question: Some people believe that people have the right to university education and government should make it free no matter what their financial background. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
shortText: It is often said that students have the right to higher education and the nation should provide it for free of cost irrespective of their economical status. However, in my perspective, I strongly believe that it should not be considered  a privilege and there should not be a compulsion on the part of the state to make it available without any cost.

question: Countries are becoming more and more similar because people are able to buy the same products anywhere in the world. Do you think this is a positive or negative development?
shortText: The world is becoming smaller every now and then. All the products are mostly available to potential customers all over the world. Even I agree that the nations are turning out to be more or less similar as most of the items are easily available globally.

question:
Some people believe that teaching children at home is best for a child’s development while others think that it is important for children to go to school.

Discuss the advantages of both methods and give your own opinion. Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
shortText: Education is considered to be the chief architect in the growth of a child and many think that a school is a go-to zone for educating them, whereas others opine this notion and believe home is the best place to educate a kid. In my opinion, the school provides more benefits, as a young mind can evolve better around each other. Though, both the standpoints have their own merits which shall be discussed in the forthcoming paragraphs.

question: In a number of countries, some people think it is necessary to spend large sums of money on constructing new railway lines for very fast trains between cities. Others believe the money should be spent on improving existing public transport. Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.
shortText: The expenditure on public transport is under debate. Pertaining to this, certain advocates believe that the maximum expenses should be diverted on the development of the novel rail tracks for superfast trains while some critics oppose the idea as they feel that the present modes of travel must be improved. question:

question:
Many childhood diseases can now be prevented through the use of vaccines.
Should parents be made by law to immunise their children against common
diseases or should individuals have the right to choose not to immunise their
children?You should use your own ideas, knowledge and experience and support your arguments with examples and relevant evidence.
shortText: Immunization is considered as a preventive measure for various types of childhood illnesses. There are 2 arguments as to whether the authority should force the society to have their child vaccinated or the resident would be given their rights for refusal. In my own view, the role of the government is to oblige the primary caregivers of today’s young generation to cooperate in the implementation of vaccination rather than giving them an option to refuse.

question: Increasing the price of petrol is the best way to solve growing traffic and pollution problems. To what extent do you agree or disagree? What other measures do you think might be effective?
shortText: Over a decade, the usage of fossil resource as a major of fuel in machinery things, especially vehicles, becomes a major of debate. The reason behind this controversy is because of the impact that it inflicts in the increasing number of traffic together with the pollution produces by them. Regarding that matter, many people think that increasing the petrol price will solve those problems, but in my opinion, I do not think it works. Therefore, in this essay, I would like to explain my belief and the effective ways to encounter those issues as well as providing a plausible conclusion.

question:
People today increasingly use credit cards to make monthly purchases.
Do the advantages of this outweigh the disadvantages
shortText: Over the last couple of decades, we have familiarized ourselves with the use of advanced payment methods. Credits cards  provide  great convenience to the human race. Credits cards are widely used for our regular expenditures and we are heavily relying on them. In this essay, While credit cards present certain drawbacks, I strongly believe that the advantages surpass the disadvantages of this payment gateway.

question: Nowadays the way many people interact with each other has changes because of technology. In what ways has technology affected the types of relationships people make? Has this become a positive or negative development?
shortText: The emergence of technology has influenced many aspects of human life, especially the way society interacts with each other. That understanding might lead to a question about how this development can change the way people communicate and the effects that it brings to us. Therefore, in this essay, I would like to suggest the answer to that case and give a plausible conclusion regarding that matter.

question:
More children in developed countries are becoming overweight. This is a serious problem for wealthy countries.

Discuss some causes and effects of this problem. Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
shortText: The overwhelming majority of kids physical fitness is moving towards the disease called obese, very rapidly which consequently causing numerous health issues across the affluent nations. Having said that, we will discuss  the various factors responsible for the above-mentioned statement and impact of it.

question:
Artists need a certain amount of freedom to develop their creativity. Some people think that artists should have total freedom to express any thoughts and ideas. 
Do advantages outweigh the disadvantages?
shortText: There is no doubt that creativity is linked strongly to freedom, and artists should be able to represent their proper ideas. While some people believe that they should have all the freedom they need to express themselves, others argue that this should be limited. In this essay, I will explore both arguments, and I will support with examples why I tend to believe that the drawbacks of having total freedom override the advantages.

question:
Many students choose to take a gap year before starting university, to travel or gain work experience.
Do you think this is a good idea or a waste of time?
shortText: Nowadays, most of the students are more on practical and they thought ahead before getting stress and pressure when they enter  university life. Some  went to other places  and explore, others find a job for experience in a certain year. I would agree with this notion, and it will give advantages of the person before jumping into a new chapter.

question: Some people think that the olympics is no longer important in the 21st century. To what extend do you agree or disagree.
shortText: In today's world, there is a controversy on the topic of the importance of Olympics in the 21st century since it is believed by some part of a population that this event may be unnecessary nowadays. I do not agree with this opinion since, firstly, Olympics keep the history and the culture inside of them and, secondly, people are motivated to do sports and other physical activities.

question:
In order to be successful at a sport, some think you must be physically strong while others believe mental strength is more important.
Discuss both views and give your own opinion.
shortText: There is no doubt that in order to play any sport successfully some requirements are needed. While some people believe that physical strength is the most important factor, others argue that mental strength should be on the top of the list. In this essay, I will discuss both arguments and I will support with examples why I agree with both views.

question: When a country develops its technology, the traditional skills and ways of life die out. It is pointless to try and keep them alive. To what extent do you agree or disagree with this opinion?
shortText: It is a common belief nowadays that fast-developing technology leads to the extinction of the authentic lifestyle, furthermore, it is commonly accepted that there is no point in keeping the traditions alive. In this essay, I will look into this opinion and will provide the reasons why I completely disagree with the statement.

question: Many people believe that companies and individuals should pay to clean up the environment in proportion to the amount of pollution they have produced. Do you agree or disagree?
shortText: The growing number of individuals think that the industries and citizens both are required to be paid for cleaning the environment. I agree with the given statement, and the reasons behind my thought will be discussed in the essay.

question: When you learn a foreign language, all four skills (listening, reading, speaking, and writing) are equally important. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
shortText: Globalization has brought in all countries across the world on to the same thread, which ought to have sound knowledge in different types of foreign languages. This mandates the equal importance of all types of skills like listening, reading, speaking and writing while learning destination countries medium of communication. I completely agree with the above statement and provide my supporting examples in this essay.

question: Computer games is very popular in all ages and nations. Parent think it has little educational Value and more harmful effects. What is your opinion about this? Give example based on your own experience.
shortText: With the advance of technology computer games' popularity started to skyrocket. However, some controversy remains regarding this matter. Parents might argue that negative side-effects may derive from playing and that it is just a waste of time. As a gamer myself I will present a strong contrary point, explaining why they help us to develop important skills and strengthen our social relationships.

question: Prision is a common way in most countries to solve the problem of crime. However, a more effective solution is to give people with a better education. Do you agree or disagree?
shortText: In today's world, prison is seen to be the most common way to prevent a large number of crimes. However, it is believed  by a certain part of a population that education might be the best solution to this problem. I agree with a presented claim since there are a lot of reasons why imprisonment is not an efficient way to solve this issue.

question:
Government should invest more money in science education rather than other subjects to develop the country.

Do you agree or disagree?
shortText: It is forecasted that a nation will make more progress if the state authorities allocate a vast amount of their budget on the technical subjects instead of others. I partially agree with the statement as an allotment in other courses are needed to maintain balance in the society.

question: Some people say that mobile phones should be banned in public places such as libraries, shops and public transport. Do you agree or disagree?
shortText: In today's world, there is a controversy about  phones and their ban in public places, such as libraries, different means of transport and shops. I agree with the fact that technologies should be prohibited in these places since it might cause inconvenience for other people.

question: In many countries around the world young people decide to leave their parents’ home once they finish school. They start living on their own or sharing a house with friends. Is this a positive or a negative development?
shortText: It is common worldwide that young adults leave their parents' house and start their own life when their studies are finished. Many of those youngsters choose to live on their own or live with a friend. I believe this choice has numerous positive sides and this essay will pinpoint some of them.

question: Some people think it would be a good idea for schools to teach every young person how to be a good parent. Do you agree or disagree with this opinion? Describe the skills a person needs to be a good parent.
shortText: Many consider that it could be an amazing idea to study parenting to adolescent at academics. I disagree with this notion and I will discuss it in the following paragraphs along with skills needed to be a good parent.

question: Schools should do more to teach students about their health and well being. Do you agree or disagree?
shortText: Primary educational institutions should educate students more about their healthfulness. I strongly agree with this idea. It is crucial to have a sound knowledge about our physical and mental well-being in the contemporary era. Besides, the essay will further articulate the vital benefits of learning; physical and mental aptitude.

question: Some people believe that having too many TV channels is good for people, while some other pole believe that it only brings some poor quality TV programs. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
shortText: It is argued that there are interesting purposes on the broadcast TV for individuals these days, meanwhile; others suppose that it is just the low-quality channels. This essay will discuss two viewpoints and I totally agree with the first one in the following paragraphs.

question: The first smartphone was released in 1992. By then year 2020 there may be as many as 2.5 billion smartphones in the world. The use of smartphones is decreasing our collective intelligence because we are reliant on the technology and not our own minds. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
shortText: In recent years, the gadgets' popularity has seen a long-term increasing tendency all over the world. There is an opinion that people use smartphones for a multitude of tasks, and it significantly impacts their ability to think. I totally agree with this statement and the following essay will explain how new technologies entail the degradation of our collective intelligence.

question: Young people today spend too much money and time following fashion trends (clothing, tech) .To what extent do you agree or disagree?
shortText: One of the basic needs of humans, i.e., clothes have now become a way to flaunt high status in society. Also, the development in science, which is mainly essential to ease and support various tasks, is now the symbol of high class for teenagers. I completely agree that our youth is wasting unnecessary time and money to buy expensive clothes and electronic equipment.

question:
Most artists earn low salaries and should therefore receive funding from the government in order for them to continue with their work.
To what extent do you agree?
shortText: It is argued that as artist receive a low pay scale and they should be provided with state funds, to preserve their interest. I strongly disagree with the statement because; firstly, the government has other sectors to improve. Secondly, the essay will discuss the way of increasing the income of the art creators.

question: Shops should sell local foods instead of foreign foods. Do you agree/disagree?
shortText: It is true that it is important to maintain local traditions and customs. However, when it comes to what shops should sell, I do not agree with the idea that stores should only sell local foods. This essay will present arguments to explain why I believe both local and foreign meals should be sold by stores.

question: Around the world more and more people today are living in urban areas. Why is this? What problems does this cause?
shortText: In today's world, a lot of people have begun to prefer living in urban areas and this has led to a variety of different consequences. Firstly, this essay will discuss the convenience of living in a city as the main reason of such a choice and, secondly, it will analyse a harmful impact on health as the major demerit of this approach.

question: With the increase in computer use, many people feel that school do not need to put the emphasis that they used to on basic handwriting skills or mathematics skills. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
shortText: It is often believed that with the excessive usage of computers in the student's life, the educational institution may ignore the basic skills of logical mathematics and handwriting which was compulsory for children in the previous days. I completely disagree with the statement and would elaborate on the views in the upcoming paragraphs.

question: Some people think certain prisoners should be made to do unpaid community work instead of being put behind bars. To what extend do you agree?
shortText: In recent years, the tendency to redesign existing types of penalties has seen a gradual long-term increase. Some people believe that it would be a more effective approach to assign some unpaid social work to criminals as punishment for their crime. I totally agree with this statement and the following essay will examine why this is a more valid measure for offenders than imprisonment.

question:
In the past, the role of a teacher was to provide information. Today, students have access to a lot of information. There is, therefore, no role for teacher in modern education.
Do you agree or disagree?
shortText: Nowadays due to advent of technology like: the internet, people believe that their children have an access to everything they need to study,as per which they do not need any teacher, however, I partially differ in this statement. This essay shall present both the sides along with relevant examples.

question: Nowadays getting a job is becoming harder in poor countries leading to a rise in unemployment. Some people believe that pupils should only be allowed to access primary education while others believe that secondary education is necessary. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
shortText: Increasing population has become a major problem resulting in unemployment in many sectors of developing and under-developed countries. Higher Studies is a need of an hour but some people still think that primary education would suffice. I agree with the former view which would be discussed in my essay.

question:
Some people think that all university students should study whatever they like.  Others believe that they should only be allowed to study subjects that will be useful in the future, such as those related to science and technology.
Discuss both these views and give your opinion.
shortText: A percentage of the population believes that youngsters can focus on the fields they like most while others argue that they must give importance to the courses like engineering, software that will be fruitful to them for their upcoming life.  Although it is true that those studies provide guaranteed employment, my opinion is inclined towards pursuing favourite topics.  This essay looks into both the views in terms of motivational factors and job opportunity.

question: Do you feel it is better for young people leaving school to study further at University or go straight into the workplace ?
shortText: Students in most of the educational institutions pursue higher education from the universities after completing their schooling. In my point of view, I feel that it is good for them to attain higher education in order to choose the field of their interest and continue their career in the same area. In the upcoming paragraphs, I would elaborate on the reason for getting higher studies with a suitable example.

question: More people decided to have children in their later age than in the past. Why? Do advantages of this outweigh disadvantages? Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
shortText: Many individuals think that there is no benefit of having babies at the early span of the marriage. However, some couples don't follow the same plan after marriage. In  further discussion, I will shed light on the advantage of having kids after a few or more years of marriage.

question:
Exams are the best way of assessing a student’s level.
To what extent do you agree or disagree?
shortText: It is true that the majority of students do not feel comfortable in doing exams or tests to assess their knowledge about a subject. However, I believe those evaluations are appropriate in order to evaluate a student. This essay will present arguments to support my opinion.

question: In modern society, some people argue that schools become unnecessary as student can study at home via the Internet. Do you agree or disagree?
shortText: Nowadays, it has become common to get an education  online. In this contemporary era, some individuals argue that studying in conventional schools is not significant and opine that studying online at home is the need of this century. I completely disagree with this notion and, I would explain the reasons for my opinion in this essay.

question:
Some people believe that hobbies need to be difficult to be enjoyable.
To what extent do you agree or disagree?
shortText: Modern life has drastically altered people's attitude to leisure activities. There is an opinion that a person can satisfy his hobby only in case he faces complications. I partially agree with this statement, and the following essay will explain my point of view.

question: Society is based on rules and laws. It could not function if individuals were free to do whatever they wanted to do. To what extent do you agree or not?
shortText: It is generally understood that society is based on rules and laws. However, others opine that society could still operate properly even if its members have the right to do anything they desired. I completely disagree with that view.

question:
Some people say the main way to be happy in life is to have a lot of money.
How might having a lot money make people happy?
What other things in life can make people happy?
shortText: In this era, money is the most important thing which makes life  easier and pleasant. However, it is necessary to make your soul more comfortable with luxury items. When a person is living a magnificence life they do not need to worry about anything and with wealth,any problem can be solved. Moreover, the family is the most delightful and peaceful way of happiness. In this essay, we will discuss both views in detail.

question:
More people decided to have children in their later age than in the past. Why?

Do advantages of this outweigh disadvantages?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
shortText: The overwhelming majority of young people are inclined to marry after graduating from university or after becoming prosperous. Young adults do not have an intention in becoming parents, as they want to travel around the world and chasing after desire. I reckon this is an absolutely positive trend.

question:
The growth of online shopping will one day lead to all shops in towns and cities closing.
Do you agree or disagree?
shortText: It is argued that online shipping has an impact on small shop vendors that may cause to shut down their business. However, I completely disagree with this statement, and this essay will discuss how local shopkeepers take advantage of instant product delivery and suggest that all people do not trust products sold online.

question: Employers should give longer holidays to employees to encourage them to do their job well. Do you agree?
shortText: There is a common belief that companies should make vacations longer for their workers. In this essay, I will explain the reasons for my opinion.

question:
Some people think that resources should be spent on protecting wild animals, while others think those would be better used for the human population.
Discuss both sides and give your own opinion.
shortText: People have contrasting views, whether it would be better to expend budget for conserving wild creatures or human progress. In my opinion, expenditure should be made on the basis of demand; however, both views will be discussed in the essay.

question:
People living in large cities have to face many problems in everyday life. What are those problems?
Should the government encourage people to move to regional towns?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.

You should write at least 254 words.
shortText: Citizens in metropolises encounter a lot of issues every day. The biggest problems are traffic jam, irritating adults and air contamination. Reducing the number of municipalities' residents is an optimal approach the administration should implement.

question:
Many people like to wear fashionable clothes.

Why do you think this is the case ?

Is this a good thing or a bad thing ?
shortText: Folks prefer to get on nifty costumes to show up their beauty so that they can get a privilege to the people. The foremost reason for this is to be popular and famous to the persons so that they can get mental satisfaction. From my perspective, this is not a good thing at all.

question: Governments should spend money on railways rather than roads. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
shortText: Railways deserve more expenditure instead of the roads by the governments. I give my vote in the support of trains because travelling through these are faster, secure, fun, and cost-efficient rather than on highways. So, spending on the railway will be profitable in the long run for both  the public and the administration.

question:
There is growing evidence that man-made activities are making global temperatures higher.

What might be the man-made causes of temperatures rising? How should we deal with this problem?

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
shortText: The overwhelming majority of people assume human-activities are destroying the ecosystem of the world. As a result, global temperature is growing continuously. In this essay, I will examine the main cause of this phenomenon, and suggest a viable solution to this issue.

question:
Nowadays for many people the Internet is replacing regular books. What do you think will
happen in the future and what is your opinion?
shortText: According to some people, the internet and connected devices are taking place of traditional books. This essay will discuss what could be expected for the future and also provide arguments to support why I believe this is a positive change.

question:
Write about the following topic:

Some people think that a sense of competition in children should be encouraged. Others believe that children who are taught to co-operate rather than compete become more useful adults.

Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
shortText: Numerous characters deem it is more righteous to incite challenges between students; in contrast, certain groups of people oppose and affirm learning to work as a team with each other is a more valuable skill than the former one in becoming respected individuals in the future. In this essay, I will discuss, firstly, why competition is essential for kids, and secondly, the merit of improving soft skills, followed by a reasoned conclusion.

question:
More and more people are relying on the private car as their major means of transportation.

Describe some of the problems over-reliance on cars can cause, and suggest at least one possible solution.

Give reasons for your answer and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
shortText: The overwhelming majority of citizens are using their own vehicles every day. This trend is followed by some drawbacks; one of these is terrible traffic jam irritating people and starting to stroll in the city is a practical solution in reducing the number of automobiles.

question: In many countries around the world young people decide to leave their parents home once they finish school. They start living on their own or share a home with friends. Some people think it is a positive thing. Do you agree or disagree?
shortText: In some states, young persons start to live individually instead of living with their family when they turned adult. Some people opine that it brings some advantages; nevertheless, I think, though such a trend has some pros, it is better to stay with the origin.

question:
Many governments think that economic progress is their most important goal. Some people, however, think that other types of progress are equally important for a country.  
Discuss both these views and give your own opinion.
shortText: As globalization prevails and more nations are achieving many advancements, more pressure is put on nations to keep up with their neighbouring countries’ development. While some governments devote most of their attention towards economic development, some citizens might argue that progress in other areas is equally important. This essay will discuss why both views have merits and why I believe the latter opinion is superior.

question: Some people believe that teenagers should be required to do unpaid community work in their free time. This can benefit teenagers and the community as well. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
shortText: One of the most conspicuous things of today's world is a discussion between people about children and their free association work during their leisure and if it can be viewed as a boon or detrimental to the society. While there is a deluge of arguments not in favour of the teenagers doing free duty, I believe, in my humble opinion, there are numerous advantages for doing social work freely.

question: Some people believe that there should be fixed punishment for each type of crime. Others, however argue that the circumstances of an individual crime and the motivation for committing it should be taken into account when deciding on the punishment. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
shortText: While some individuals opine that penalty for any offence should be constant, others think that the background should also be considered. In my opinion, the situation of crime is required to be analyzed during judgement; however, both views will be discussed in the essay.

question:
Some people believe that after a child enters school their teachers will have more influence than their parents.

To what extent do you agree or disagree?
shortText: There is no doubt that children are impressionable. There are many people who think that after going to school, the learners attend their class coordinators.I completely disagree with this statement. It has more factors to be considered.

question: In some societies, more and more people are choosing to live on their own? What are the reasons people choose to do this? Is it a positive or negative trend?
shortText: With the advancements in technology and also because of globalisation an increasing number of people are becoming self-sufficient. In my perspective,this is definitely a pragmatic trend and should be supported. However, there are various reasons behind it, which are illustrated in the further essay.

question: In many countries, people are moving away from rural areas towards urban areas. Why do you think that is? What problems can it cause?
shortText: It is undeniable that the public prefers to live in cities rather than villages, whereas it becomes their priority in these days and individuals are migrating to the metropolis from remote areas. In my opinion, there are a plethora of reasons behind it whilst they are moving for a better lifestyle, such as education, job opportunities and exceptional facilities. Additionally, this trend could create some complications in cities as well over-crowded places become more expensive because of scarcity in every market.

question:
Some people think its better to choose friends who always have the same opinions as them.
Other people believe that it's good to have friends who sometimes disagree with them
shortText: Friendship is a superb relationship between two or more individuals that can support them in all situation throughout the whole life. It is often argued that one always has a friend with the same point of view as them whilst others believe that a person should have a mate, who has different opinions as he or she has. In my opinion, I agree with the second statement that an individual should make friend with different thinking and views, so he could motivate them in different dilemmas and guide them with new ideas.

question: Some people think that hard work and determination bring success. Others think other factors such as money and good appearance are more important. Discuss both views and give your opinion?
shortText: There are different factors that lead to success. While there are many supporters for hard-working and good attitude, many argue that wealth and look give more advantages. In my opinion, while all aspects mentioned matter, efforts are more crucial to a successful career.

question: Some people think that hard work and determination bring success. Others think other factors such as money and good appearance are more important. Discuss both views and give your opinion?
shortText: There are different factors that lead to success. While many people believe in hard-working and good attitudes, others argue that wealth and look may give more advantages. In my opinion, while all aspects mentioned matter, efforts are more crucial to a successful career.

question:
In many countries, people are moving away from rural areas towards urban areas. 

Why do you think that is?

What problems can it cause?

In my point of view, there are various reasons behind this cause. In the upcoming paragraphs, I will elaborate on the reasons and problems caused due to the migration process.

question: In some countries, most people prefer to rent their homes rather than buying them. What are some of the advantages and disadvantages of renting homes?
shortText: In certain nations, the majority of the population prefer renting their houses in-place of purchasing them. there are merits as well as demerits of the aforementioned situation. question:
In the future, nobody will buy printed newspapers or books because they will be able to read everything they want online without paying.
To what extent do you agree or disagree with this statement.
shortText: It is argued that in the upcoming day's people will prefer reading through electronic medium and the printed news and books will be out of the trend. I hold a partial opinion because opting for digital ways had its own pros and cons. Reading online prevents excessive usage of paper which helps in saving trees; whereas, it comes with various health issues as well.

question: As computers translate quickly and accurately, learning foreign languages is a waste of time. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
shortText: Since the translation performed by computing systems is fast and is quite correct so, time consumed to imbibe a foreign language is wasted. I completely disagree with the aforementioned statement. The reasons behind the above disagreement will be discussed in the essay below with relevant examples.

question:
Some museums and art galleries charge admission fees, while others have free entry.

Do you think the advantages of charging for admission outweigh the disadvantages?
shortText: Numerous characters deem the population pays money to visit the museum, which is righteous and reasonable; in contrast, certain groups of people oppose and affirm the idea that no tax is appropriate for the public. In this essay, I will examine, firstly, the merit of the free service, and secondly the possible negative aspect of this phenomenon, followed by a reasoned conclusion.

question: As most people spend a major part of their adult life at work, job satisfaction is an important element of individual wellbeing. What factors contribute to job satisfaction for all workers? How realistic is the expectation of job satisfaction for all workers?
shortText: Nowadays, most people devote considerable time to their work during adulthood. There is no denying that the work contentment could increase the feeling of wellbeing. In order to shed more light on this issue, it is necessary to know what factors influence employees’ career fulfilment and also how the feasible expectation of job contentment for workers has.

question: Some believe that charitable organisations should help people no matter where they live. Others argue that charities should only help those living in the country where the charity is based. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
shortText: It is argued that charity groups assist only those who live within their national boundaries; meanwhile, others opine that they should provide their assistance in four corners of the world. From my perspective, I strongly agree with the first one. This essay will provide some cases and examples to support my point of view.

question:
Violence in society increases when more violence is shown on television.


To what extent do you agree or disagree?
shortText: In recent years, the level of violation in societies has seen a long-term gradual increasing tendency. Some believe that violence, which is promoted via mass media, entails this negative movement. I totally agree with this statement and the following essay will explain my point of view.

question: Some people think that we can not learn anything from the past for our life today, while others believe that history is a valuable source of information to understand human life. Discuss both views and give your opinion.
shortText: History is an important aspect linked to mankind. some people argue that the past contains a precious amount of data to understand human life; however, others think that it is useless these days as it does not help to learn anything. I agree that the past is a very considerable factor to recognize human life because it helps to learn about the civilization and background of mankind. In this essay, both views will be discussed.

question:
Some people think that teenagers should follow the example of older people. Others think that it is natural for teenagers to challenge what older people say. 

Discuss both views and give your opinion.
shortText: A highly controversial issue relates to whether elderly people should be listened by youngers or if it is common that their experience is not applicable for younger lives. In this essay, I will examine both points  of view and explain why the arguments for accepting elderly advice are stronger.

question: Shopping is the favorite pastime for most of the young people. Why do you think is that? Do you think they should be encouraged to do some useful activities in their free time?
shortText: Shopping is the most loving way to spend free-time among the majority of the youth and I believe that it should not be an every time affair, however, it is felt by me that these individuals should be motivated to perform certain meaningful pursuits. Both these thoughts will be discussed in the essay below with relevant examples.

question: Some people believe that air travel should be restricted because it causes serious pollution and will use up the world’s resources. Do you agree or disagree?
shortText: Nowadays,air transport is one of the world’s most essential business. Its development and its technical and service achievements make it one of the greatest contributors to the advancement of modern society. While aviation somehow has adverse effects on the environment, I totally disagree with the view of limiting it due to its enormous benefits on both economic and social aspects.

question: Increasing numbers of students are choosing to study abroad. To what extent does this trend benefit the students themselves and the countries involved? What are the drawbacks?
shortText: Nowadays,there are more and more people who want to study abroad.This essay will discuss how this great opportunity can be an advantage for a candidate and their countries, however, there are also negative consequences of this decision.

question: In many places women are taking jobs which are traditionally done by men. What do you think make these change happen. What's your opinion about it.
shortText: There is currently a contentious argument over about for what reasons females are filling positions which were usually occupied by males in the past. This essay will examine some root causes related to this trend and present my opinion about it.

question:
Some people claim that the government should provide free health care. Others think that the government will not provide the most innovative methods of treatment and it's better to invest those funds in education and culture.
What is your opinion?
shortText: Everyone desires better health. It is argued that either the government should provide complete healthcare for free or avoid some special treatments. In my opinion, the authorities should provide basic healthcare free of cost and they should avoid treating rare diseases. In this essay, the role of the states in facilitating  medical services will be discussed.

question:

shortText: There is no doubt that streaming has been implemented in many educational institutions. Without capital punishment (the death penalty) our lives are less secure and crimes of

people now have freedom to live and work anyhwhere in the world due to the development in the communication and transport.

question: Some people feel that the cost of space exploration is far too high for the benefits it brings while others argue that we space programmers should continue no matter what the cost. Discuss both sides and give your own opinion.
shortText: There is no doubt that the space is still unexplored and unknown. While some argue that these explorations cost more than its advantages, I believe if we want to expand our knowledge beyond our planet. We should continue this effort. This essay will discuss both sides of the argument.

question: Improvements in health, education and trade are essential for the development of poorer nations. However, the governments of richer nations should take more responsibility for helping the poorer nations in such areas. to what extend do you agree, give your own opinion.
